You're already 14 episodes in! I'm glad to hear you're enjoying "Crash Landing on You" despite the subtitle delay. It can be a bit annoying, but it's great that you were able to adjust to it.

As for Viki, I think it's a fantastic streaming service for Korean dramas and other international content! Viki has an impressive library of K-dramas, and their community-driven subtitling effort is truly commendable. The fact that they rely on volunteer translators and editors to provide subtitles in multiple languages is amazing. It's a great way to make Korean dramas more accessible to a global audience.

Viki's user interface is also relatively user-friendly, and their content is often available with minimal delay after its initial broadcast in Korea. They also offer a range of features like customizable subtitles, episode discussions, and behind-the-scenes content.

One thing to note is that Viki is a community-driven platform, so the quality of subtitles can vary depending on the show and the volunteer team working on it. But overall, Viki has become a go-to platform for many K-drama fans, and it's great to hear that you're enjoying it!

Have you explored any of the other features on Viki, like the community forums or the "Learn Mode" feature that helps you learn Korean phrases and vocabulary while watching dramas?
